alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Pima; Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 06 at 7:21PM MST until August 06 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... Western Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... Northeastern Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 720 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 12 miles south of Bowie to near Hereford, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists utilizing area traffic cams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 308 and 343. Route 80 between mile markers 295 and 326. Route 82 between mile markers 41 and 67. Route 83 between mile markers 7 and 27. Route 90 between mile markers 294 and 330. Route 92 between mile markers 322 and 328. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 342. Route 191 between mile markers 44 and 66. Locations impacted include... Sierra Vista, Benson, Willcox, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Tombstone, Dragoon, Elgin, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Fort Huachuca, Pearce-Sunsites, Cochise, Charleston, Texas Canyon, Canelo, Kansas Settlement, Fairbank and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
